task.title: Installing the HCLTech PDF stylesheet plugin

info.p: This folder contains the DITA-OT plugins.

step.cmd: Git clone the contents https://github.hpe.com/hpe/cms-techdocs-dita-stylesheet.git to the folder created in the preceding step.

ul.li: The master branch contains the production stylesheet. You must use this branch for building documentation deliverables.
The beta branch contains the development version. Use this branch for testing but do never for building official documentation deliverables, unless instructed otherwise.
The legacy branch contains the legacy stylesheet developed for DITA-OT 2.2.1.

info.note:
Use the command git clone git@github.hpe.com:hpe/cms-techdocs-dita-stylesheet.git .
to clone the repo with only the contents (and then there won't be a top level folder such as cms-techdocs-dita-stylesheet created). The . at the end is what is needed for this.

step.cmd: Integrate the new plugin. This is easiest done using the command line.

info.p: In a Windows command line, execute C:\DITA\dita-ot-3.7.4\bin\dita install.
You must receive the response: Added com.hcltech.ctgpdf.

result.p: The plugin is integrated and ready to use. You can validate this with the command: C:\DITA\dita-ot-3.7.4\bin\dita transtypes
The list must include hclctgpdf, which is the transformation type defined in the plugin.
